content.text:
# List of Cultural Properties of Japan – historical materials (Shizuoka)

This list is of the Cultural Properties of Japan designated in the category of  for the Prefecture of Shizuoka.
National Cultural Properties
As of 1 February 2015, three Important Cultural Properties have been designated, being of national significance.
{| class="wikitable sortable"  style="width:100%;"
|-
!width="25%" align="left" | Property
!width="10%" align="left" data-sort-type="number" | Date
!width="10%" align="left" | Municipality
!width="10%" align="left" | Ownership
!width="25%" align="left" class="unsortable" | Comments
!width="10%" align="left" class="unsortable" | Image
!width="5%" align="left" class="unsortable" | Coordinates
!width="5%" align="left" class="unsortable" | Ref.
|-
| align="center"|Photographs relating to the Egawa FamilyEgawa-ke kankei shashin ||  || Izunokuni ||  || 461 items, including a photograph (pictured) of  by Nakahama Manjirō ||  ||  || [https://kunishitei.bunka.go.jp/heritage/detail/201/00011600 ]
|-
| align="center"|Materials relating to Tokugawa IeyasuTokugawa Ieyasu kankei shashin ||  || Shizuoka || Kunōzan Tōshō-gū || 169 items dedicated to Kunōzan Tōshōgū; official documents, paintings, writings, and personal effects, including an incense set, tea utensils, medical implements, arms and armour, horse trappings, and a clock given by Philip III of Spain in 1611 after the rescue two years before of 317 of the 373 crew of a wrecked Spanish ship and their repatriation on a ship designed by William Adams; the clock, inscribed Hans de Evalo Me Fecit En Madrid A 1581, is preserved along with its leather case|| ||  || [https://kunishitei.bunka.go.jp/heritage/detail/201/10148 ]
|-
| align="center"|Materials relating to the Egawa Family Nirayama MagistratesNirayama Daikan Egawa-ke kankei shiryō ||  || Izunokuni ||  || 38,581 items ||  ||  || [https://kunishitei.bunka.go.jp/heritage/detail/201/00011599 ]
|-
|}
Prefectural Cultural Properties
As of 1 December 2013, two properties have been designated at a prefectural level.
